description: ERECTION OF SINGLE STOREY OUTBUILDING INCIDENTAL TO THE MAIN GROUND FLOOR DWELLING
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 
Site Location Plan
Elevation drawings by Dunster House Dominator Pressure Treated Garden Office
Plans

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form and approved drawings unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - The development hereby permitted shall not be rented, sold independently or occupied at any time other than for purposes incidental to the main residential use of the dwelling known as Flat 1, 10 Abbott Avenue Raynes Park, SW20 8SQ.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no fencing or walls, which would sub-divide the site and separate the outbuilding hereby approved from the residential curtilage of the main dwelling, shall be constructed without planning permission first obtained from the Local Planning Authority.	

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of neighbouring residents, to prevent the unauthorised introduction of an independent use and to ensure compliance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan 2021 and policies D12.1 & D12.3 of the Local Plan 2024.

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].
Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE: The applicant is advised to contact Network Rail prior to commencement of development to ensure railway safety and prevent disruption.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE: The applicant is reminded that this permission has been issued on the basis that the outbuilding will be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the dwellinghouse only. This permission does not permit the use of the outbuilding for primary living accommodation or as a self contained residential unit. Any use falling outside the scope of 'incidental' would potentially render the use unlawful and subject to enforcement action.
